question: Which edition of the Summer Olympic Games was hosted by Paris in 2024?
solution: The Paris Olympics 2024 marked the 33rd edition of the Summer Olympic Games. Paris became the second city after London to host the Olympics three times‚Äîin 1900, 1924, and now 2024, commemorating the centenary of its last hosting.

question: What is the official theme of the Paris Olympics 2024?
solution: The theme of the Paris Olympics 2024 is ‚ÄúGames Wide Open‚Äù, which symbolizes openness, inclusivity, and global participation. It reflects Paris‚Äôs aim to host an Olympic Games that is accessible to all, breaking traditional boundaries and embracing innovation, sustainability, and cultural celebration.

question: What are the mascots of Paris Olympics 2024 called?
solution:
The official mascots of Paris 2024 Olympics and Paralympics are called Phryges, inspired by the Phrygian cap, a symbol of liberty and revolution in France. These vibrant red figures represent freedom, solidarity, and the spirit of the French Revolution, aligning with France‚Äôs historical identity and modern values of inclusivity.

question: Where will the closing ceremony of the Paris Olympics 2024 be held?
solution: The closing ceremony of the Paris Olympics 2024 will be held at the iconic Stade de France in Saint-Denis, just north of Paris. As France‚Äôs largest stadium, it will host thousands of athletes and spectators, marking the culmination of the Games with a celebration of culture, unity, and Olympic spirit.

question: Who were the flag bearers of India during the opening ceremony of the Paris Olympics 2024?

question: Who represented India as a torchbearer in the Paris 2024 Olympic Torch Relay?
solution: Abhinav Bindra, India‚Äôs first individual Olympic gold medalist (Beijing 2008, 10m air rifle), proudly carried the Olympic flame during the Paris 2024 Torch Relay. His participation symbolized peace, perseverance, and India‚Äôs growing stature in global sports.

question: What do the five interlocking rings on the Olympic flag symbolize?
option_1: The five Olympic values
option_3: The five original host nations
option_4: The five continents of the world
solution:
The five interlocking rings‚Äîblue, yellow, black, green, and red‚Äîon the Olympic flag represent the five continents of the world: Africa, the Americas, Asia, Europe, and Oceania. Designed in 1913 by Pierre de Coubertin, the rings symbolize unity through sport and the idea that athletes from all continents participate in the Games.

question: The Paris 2024 Olympics mark the return of the Games to the city after how many years?
solution: The Paris 2024 Summer Olympics mark the return of the Games to the French capital exactly 100 years after it last hosted them in 1924. Paris also hosted the Olympics in 1900, making 2024 its third time as host. With this, Paris becomes the second city after London to host the Olympics three times.

question: Which country topped the overall medal tally at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
solution: The United States finished at the top of the Paris 2024 Olympics medal tally with 126 medals (40 gold, 44 silver, 42 bronze). China followed with 91 medals (40 gold, 27 silver, 24 bronze). While both nations won 40 golds, the USA took the lead due to a higher number of silver and bronze medals.

question: What was India‚Äôs final rank in the overall medal tally at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
solution: India secured the 71st position in the Paris 2024 Olympics medal tally with a total of 6 medals‚Äî1 silver and 5 bronze. This marks a decline from its 48th rank in the Tokyo 2020 Olympics, where India won 7 medals, including a gold. Despite fewer podium finishes, standout performances by athletes such as Manu Bhaker (double bronze) and Neeraj Chopra (silver) added historic value, with Neeraj becoming the first Indian to win both gold and silver at the Olympics.

question: Who became the first Indian woman to serve as a jury member at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
solution: Bilquis Mir, a canoeist from Jammu and Kashmir, made history by becoming the first Indian woman appointed as a jury member at the Paris 2024 Olympics. Her journey began in Dal Lake in 1998, and she rose through the ranks despite societal challenges. She previously served as a jury member at the Hangzhou Asian Games and is also a national coach for canoeing and kayaking. Her appointment was officially conveyed by the Indian Olympic Association, marking a proud moment for India and a milestone for women in sports.

question: Who served as the President of the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) during the Paris 2024 Olympics?
solution: Legendary sprinter P. T. Usha, popularly known as the "Payyoli Express", served as the President of the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) during the Paris 2024 Olympics, becoming the first woman president in the IOA‚Äôs 95-year history. The IOA was established in 1927 and is headquartered in New Delhi. Under her leadership, the IOA implemented athlete-focused reforms such as advanced medical support, recovery centers, and strategic planning for India‚Äôs 2036 Olympic bid.

question: What historic achievements did Manu Bhaker accomplish at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
option_1: First Indian woman to win an Olympic medal in shooting
option_2: First Indian woman to reach an Olympic shooting final in an individual event in 20 years
option_3: First Indian athlete to win two medals at a single Olympics since Independence
option_4: All of the above
solution:
At the Paris 2024 Olympics, Manu Bhaker etched her name in history by achieving three major milestones:
  • She became the first Indian woman to win an Olympic medal in shooting, clinching bronze in the 10m air pistol event.
  • She was the first Indian woman in 20 years to reach an individual Olympic shooting final, ending a long drought.
  • She won a second bronze in the 10m air pistol mixed team event, making her the first Indian athlete since Independence to win two medals at a single Olympics.

question: Which athlete won the gold medal in men‚Äôs javelin throw at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
solution: Arshad Nadeem of Pakistan won the gold medal in men‚Äôs javelin throw at the Paris 2024 Olympics with a record-breaking throw of 97 meters, setting a new Olympic record. This was Pakistan‚Äôs first Olympic gold since 1984 and its first-ever individual Olympic gold. He outperformed Neeraj Chopra of India, who secured silver with 89.45 meters, and Anderson Peters of Grenada, who took bronze with 88.54 meters.

question: Who became the youngest Indian Olympic medalist by winning a bronze in wrestling at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
solution: Aman Sehrawat, a freestyle wrestler from Haryana, won the bronze medal in the 57kg category at the Paris 2024 Olympics, becoming the youngest Indian Olympic medalist at 21 years and 24 days. He broke the previous record held by PV Sindhu, who was 21 years, 1 month, and 14 days old when she won silver at Rio 2016. Aman defeated Darian Cruz of Puerto Rico with a score of 13‚Äì5 in the bronze medal match, marking India‚Äôs first wrestling medal at Paris 2024 and its sixth overall.

question: Which Indian athlete became the first to win two Olympic medals in javelin throw?
solution: Neeraj Chopra made history at the Paris 2024 Olympics by winning the silver medal in men‚Äôs javelin throw with a best attempt of 45 meters. He had previously won gold at Tokyo 2020, making him the first Indian to win two Olympic medals in javelin throw and the first Indian to win an Olympic gold in athletics. His consistent excellence has placed him among India‚Äôs most decorated athletes in track and field.

question: Which Indian shooter won the bronze medal in the men‚Äôs 50m Rifle 3 Positions event at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
option_2: Aishwary Pratap Singh Tomar
solution: Swapnil Kusale clinched the bronze medal in the men‚Äôs 50m Rifle 3 Positions event at the Paris 2024 Olympics with a score of 4, marking India‚Äôs first-ever Olympic medal in this category. Competing at his maiden Olympics, he became India‚Äôs third shooting medalist at Paris 2024, joining Manu Bhaker and Sarabjot Singh. The event was held at the National Shooting Center in Ch√¢teauroux, and Kusale‚Äôs performance was a result of consistent shooting across kneeling, prone, and standing positions. The gold went to Liu Yukun (China) and silver to Serhiy Kulish (Ukraine).

question: Which Indian shooting pair won the bronze medal in the 10m Air Pistol mixed team event at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
option_1: Sarabjot Singh & Manu Bhaker
option_2: Shiva Narwal & Palak Gulia
option_3: Arjun Singh Cheema & Rhythm Sangwan
option_4: Saurabh Chaudhary & Divya TS
solution: Sarabjot Singh and Manu Bhaker clinched the bronze medal in the 10m Air Pistol mixed team event at the Paris 2024 Olympics, defeating South Korea‚Äôs Wonho Lee and Oh Ye Jin with a score of 16‚Äì10. This marked India‚Äôs first Olympic medal in a shooting team event. It was Sarabjot‚Äôs debut Olympic podium, while Manu Bhaker became the first Indian athlete to win two medals in a single Olympic edition, having already secured bronze in the women‚Äôs 10m Air Pistol event.

question: Which team did the Indian men‚Äôs hockey team defeat to win the bronze medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
solution: The Indian men‚Äôs hockey team won the bronze medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics by defeating Spain 2‚Äì1 in the bronze medal match. Spain took the lead through a penalty stroke by Marc Miralles, but captain Harmanpreet Singh scored twice‚Äîonce just before halftime and again early in the third quarter‚Äîto secure the win. This marked India‚Äôs second consecutive Olympic bronze in men‚Äôs hockey after Tokyo 2020, and their 13th Olympic medal overall in the sport. It was also the farewell match for veteran goalkeeper PR Sreejesh, who made crucial saves to preserve the lead.

question: Who was the lone athlete to represent India during its first Olympic appearance in 1900?
solution: India made its Olympic debut in 1900 at the Paris Games, becoming the first Asian nation to participate in the modern Olympics. The country was represented by Norman Pritchard, an Anglo-Indian athlete who competed in five athletics events and won two silver medals‚Äîin the 200m sprint and 200m hurdles. These were India‚Äôs first Olympic medals, and until 2020, the only ones in athletics. Although Pritchard later moved to Britain and acted in Hollywood, the International Olympic Committee officially credits his medals to India.

question: In which sport did India win six consecutive Olympic gold medals between 1928 and 1956?
solution: India‚Äôs men‚Äôs field hockey team achieved an extraordinary feat by winning six consecutive Olympic gold medals from 1928 (Amsterdam) to 1956 (Melbourne). Led by legendary players like Dhyan Chand, Balbir Singh Sr., and others, the team remained unbeaten in 24 matches, scoring 178 goals and conceding just 7. This golden era cemented India‚Äôs legacy as the most dominant force in Olympic hockey history.

question: Who was the first Indian woman to win an Olympic medal?
solution: Karnam Malleswari became the first Indian woman to win an Olympic medal by clinching bronze in weightlifting at the 2000 Sydney Olympics. She lifted 110 kg in snatch and 130 kg in clean and jerk, totaling 240 kg in the 69 kg category. Her medal was India‚Äôs only podium finish at Sydney 2000 and made her the first Indian weightlifter‚Äîmale or female‚Äîto win an Olympic medal. Malleswari‚Äôs achievement paved the way for future generations of Indian women athletes.

question: PV Sindhu is the first Indian woman to win how many individual Olympic medals?
solution: PV Sindhu is the first Indian woman to win two individual Olympic medals. She won a silver medal in women‚Äôs singles badminton at the Rio 2016 Olympics, becoming the first Indian to reach an Olympic badminton final. She followed it up with a bronze medal at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics, defeating China‚Äôs He Bingjiao in the playoff. Sindhu‚Äôs consistent Olympic performances have made her one of India‚Äôs most decorated athletes. She aimed for a third medal at Paris 2024, but was eliminated in the round of 16.

question: Which Indian woman wrestler was disqualified from the gold medal match at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
solution: Vinesh Phogat reached the final of the 50kg freestyle category at Paris 2024, defeating former Olympic champions from Japan, Ukraine, and Cuba. However, on the morning of the final, she was found to be overweight by 150 grams during the mandatory second-day weigh-in. As per United World Wrestling regulations, this led to her disqualification, and she was denied any medal despite her historic run. The gold was awarded to Guzm√°n, and Susaki faced Livach for the bronze medal.

question: Who was the first Indian to win an individual Olympic gold medal?
solution: Abhinav Bindra became the first Indian to win an individual Olympic gold medal by triumphing in the 10m Air Rifle event at the Beijing 2008 Olympics, scoring 5 to surpass China‚Äôs Zhu Qinan. His victory broke a century-long barrier for India in individual events. Bindra chronicled his journey in the book A Shot at History: My Obsessive Journey to Olympic Gold, co-authored with Rohit Brijnath, offering deep insight into his relentless pursuit of perfection, setbacks at Athens 2004, and scientific approach to training.

question: Which edition of the Summer Paralympic Games was held in Paris in 2024?
solution: The Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics marked the 17th edition (XVII) of the Games, held from 28 August to 8 September 2024. It was the first time France hosted the Summer Paralympics, with events staged across iconic venues like the Eiffel Tower, Ch√¢teau de Versailles, and Stade de France. The Games featured 4,463 athletes from 170 nations, competing in 549 events across 22 sports. India recorded its best-ever performance, winning 29 medals and finishing 18th in the medal tally.

question: Who was appointed as the Chef de Mission (Head of Mission) for India‚Äôs contingent at the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics?
solution: Satya Prakash Sangwan, Vice-President of the Paralympic Committee of India (PCI), was appointed as the Chef de Mission for India‚Äôs contingent at the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics. He led India‚Äôs largest-ever para-athlete delegation, comprising 84 athletes across 12 sports disciplines. Sangwan has been a key figure in India‚Äôs para-sports movement for over a decade, and his leadership was expected to play a pivotal role in ensuring logistical coordination, athlete support, and strategic planning during the Games.

question: Who were India‚Äôs flag bearers at the opening ceremony of the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics?
option_1: Avani Lekhara and Harvinder Singh
option_2: Bhagyashree Jadhav and Sumit Antil
option_3: Deepa Malik and Devendra Jhajharia
option_4: Preeti Pal and Rakesh Kumar
solution: Bhagyashree Jadhav (shot put, F34 category) and Sumit Antil (javelin throw, F64 category) were chosen as India‚Äôs flag bearers for the opening ceremony of the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics. Their selection recognized their consistent international performances and leadership in para-athletics. Sumit was a reigning Paralympic gold medalist and world record holder, while Bhagyashree had earned silver at the World Para Athletics Championships earlier in 2024.

question: Who represented India as flag bearers during the closing ceremony of the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics?
option_1: Bhagyashree Jadhav and Sumit Antil
option_2: Preeti Pal and Harvinder Singh
option_3: Deepa Malik and Mariyappan Thangavelu
option_4: Rubina Francis and Rakesh Kumar
solution: Preeti Pal, India‚Äôs first track medalist at the Paralympics (bronze in 100m and 200m T35), and Harvinder Singh, India‚Äôs first Paralympic gold medalist in archery, were selected as flag bearers for the closing ceremony of the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics. Their achievements symbolized India‚Äôs historic performance at the Games, where the country secured a record 29 medals, finishing 18th in the overall tally.

question: Who was the President of the Paralympic Committee of India (PCI) during the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics?
solution: Devendra Jhajharia, a two-time Paralympic gold medalist, served as the President of the Paralympic Committee of India (PCI) during the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics. He was elected to the post in March 2024, succeeding Deepa Malik. Under his leadership, India fielded its largest-ever para-athlete contingent, and achieved a record medal haul, reflecting his commitment to athlete support, grassroots development, and strategic planning.

question: Which country topped the medal table at the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics for the sixth consecutive time?
solution: China led the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics medal table for the sixth consecutive time, winning 94 gold, 76 silver, and 51 bronze medals, totaling 221 medals. Great Britain secured second place for the tenth time, with 49 golds and 124 total medals, while the United States finished third, earning 36 golds and 105 total medals. China‚Äôs dominance was fueled by standout performances in athletics, swimming, table tennis, and fencing, and the team broke 29 world records during the Games.

question: What was India‚Äôs overall performance at the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics?
solution: India achieved its best-ever Paralympic performance at the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics, winning a record 29 medals‚Äî7 gold, 9 silver, and 13 bronze‚Äîand finishing 18th in the overall medal tally. This surpassed India‚Äôs previous best of 19 medals at Tokyo 2020. Notable gold medalists included Avani Lekhara, Sumit Antil, and Harvinder Singh, with standout performances in shooting, athletics, and archery. India‚Äôs medal haul spanned five sports, with athletics contributing 17 medals. The delegation featured 84 athletes across 12 disciplines, including debut entries in para cycling, para rowing, and blind judo.

question: When did India officially make its debut at the Summer Paralympics?
solution: India made its official debut at the 1968 Summer Paralympics held in Tel Aviv, Israel. Since then, India has appeared in every edition of the Summer Paralympics from 1984 onwards. The Paris 2024 Games mark India‚Äôs 13th appearance at the Summer Paralympics. Over the years, India‚Äôs participation has grown steadily, both in athlete strength and medal achievements‚Äîculminating in a record haul of 29 medals at Paris.

question: Which new sports did Indian para-athletes participate in for the first time at the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics?
option_1: Para canoe, para taekwondo, para archery
option_2: Para badminton, para shooting, para swimming
option_3: Para athletics, para table tennis, para powerlifting
option_4: Para cycling, para rowing, and blind judo
solution: At the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics, Indian para-athletes made their debut in three new sports: para cycling, para rowing, and blind judo. This expansion brought India‚Äôs total participation to 12 disciplines, up from 9 at Tokyo 2020, and reflected the country‚Äôs growing investment in diverse para-sport development. Athletes like Arshad Shaik and Jyoti Gaderiya competed in para cycling, while Anita and K. Narayana represented India in para rowing. In blind judo, Kapil Parmar and Kokila made history as India‚Äôs first entrants in the sport.

question: Who became the first Indian woman to win two gold medals in shooting at the Paralympic Games?
solution: Avani Lekhara created history at the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics, becoming the first Indian woman to win two gold medals in shooting. She successfully defended her title in the women‚Äôs 10m air rifle standing SH1 event, scoring 7 points‚Äîa new Paralympic record, beating her own score of 249.6 set at Tokyo 2020. She clinched India‚Äôs first gold medal at Paris 2024 and became the second Indian overall (after Devendra Jhajharia) to win two Paralympic golds. The event also saw Mona Agarwal win bronze, securing India‚Äôs first double podium finish in Paralympic shooting.

question: Which Indian para-athletes achieved a historic one-two finish in athletics at the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics?
option_1: Sumit Antil and Harvinder Singh
option_2: Avani Lekhara and Mona Agarwal
option_3: Dharambir and Pranav Soorma
option_4: Amit Saroha and Kapil Parmar
solution: Dharambir and Pranav Soorma secured a historic one-two finish for India in the men‚Äôs club throw F51 event at the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics. Dharambir clinched gold with a throw of 92m, setting a new Asian record, while Pranav Soorma earned silver with a best effort of 34.59m. This marked India‚Äôs first-ever 1-2 finish in any track and field event at the Paralympics, showcasing the country‚Äôs growing strength in para-athletics. Their achievement pushed India‚Äôs medal tally to a record-breaking 24 at the Games.

question: Who became the first Indian man to successfully defend his Paralympic title, setting a new Games record in javelin throw at Paris 2024?
solution: Sumit Antil made history at the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics by becoming the first Indian man to defend his Paralympic title, winning gold in the men‚Äôs javelin throw F64 event. He recorded a stunning throw of 70.59 meters, breaking his own previous Paralympic record of 68.55m set at Tokyo 2020. Antil‚Äôs achievement placed him in an elite group of Indian athletes with two Paralympic golds, alongside Avani Lekhara and Devendra Jhajharia. His victory also marked India‚Äôs third gold medal at Paris 2024 and reinforced his status as the reigning world champion in the F64 category.

question: Which Indian para-athlete won medals in high jump at three consecutive Paralympic Games?
solution: Mariyappan Thangavelu became the first Indian para-athlete to win medals in high jump at three consecutive Paralympic Games. He won gold at Rio 2016, silver at Tokyo 2020, and bronze at Paris 2024 in the men‚Äôs high jump T63 category. His bronze-winning jump of 85m in Paris followed his earlier marks of 1.89m (Rio) and 1.86m (Tokyo). This remarkable consistency highlights his resilience, skill, and legacy in Indian para-athletics. In Paris, fellow Indian Sharad Kumar won silver in the same event, making it a double podium for India.

question: Who became the first Indian to win a medal in a track event at the Paralympic Games?
solution: Preethi Pal made history at the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics by becoming the first Indian to win a medal in a track event, clinching bronze in the women‚Äôs 100m T35 race with a personal best of 21 seconds. She later added another bronze in the 200m T35, becoming the first Indian woman to win two medals in track and field at the Paralympics. Her achievement marked a turning point for India in para-athletics, which had previously only yielded medals in field events.

question: Who became India‚Äôs first-ever Paralympic gold medalist in archery?
solution: Harvinder Singh became the first Indian to win a Paralympic gold medal in archery at the Paris 2024 Summer Paralympics, defeating Poland‚Äôs Lukasz Ciszek 6‚Äì0 in the men‚Äôs individual recurve open final. This victory followed his bronze medal at Tokyo 2020, making him a two-time Paralympic medalist. Harvinder‚Äôs triumph marked a milestone for Indian para-archery and added to India‚Äôs growing medal tally in Paris.

question: When did women officially make their debut at the Olympic Games?
solution: Women first competed at the Olympic Games in 1900, held in Paris, France. Out of 997 athletes, only 22 were women, participating in five sports: tennis, golf, sailing, croquet, and equestrianism. This marked a significant milestone in Olympic history, though women‚Äôs participation remained limited for decades. The Paris 2024 Olympics celebrated full gender parity, with equal numbers of male and female athletes for the first time.

question: How many gold medals did India win at the Paris 2024 Paralympic Games?
solution:
India clinched 7 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Paralympics, its best performance to date. These victories came in Athletics, Shooting, and Badminton.

The gold medalists were:

  • Avani Lekhara in Women‚Äôs 10m Air Rifle Standing SH1
  • Sumit Antil in Men‚Äôs Javelin Throw F64
  • Dharambir in Men‚Äôs Club Throw F51
  • Praveen Kumar in Men‚Äôs High Jump T64
  • Navdeep Singh in Men‚Äôs Javelin Throw F41
  • Harvinder Singh in Men‚Äôs Individual Recurve Open (Archery)
  • Nitesh Kumar in Men‚Äôs Singles SL3 (Badminton)
